dungeon.model.items.mobs
Class Mob

java.lang.Object
  dungeon.model.items.Item
      dungeon.model.items.mobs.Mob
All Implemented Interfaces:
Persistent
Direct Known Subclasses:
Creature, Hero
public abstract class Mob
extends Item
implements Persistent

Abstract class to represent any mobile item in the dungeon
Derived classes are Hero and Creature

getFaction

public abstract String getFaction()
Computer-controlled mobs will not attack other mobs if they are in the same faction

Returns:
Returns the mob's faction name

getSpeed

public abstract double getSpeed()
Returns:
Returns the mob's speed

getDefence

public abstract int getDefence()
Mobs with higher defence values (perhaps due to armour) are more difficult to hit in combat

Returns:
Returns the mob's defence value

Mobs with higher strength can carry more treasure

public Key findKey(int door_id)
Looks through the mob's inventory for a key to the given door

Returns:

                               Attack attack)

Parameters:
game - The game state

Returns:

nearbyDoors

Note: This method ignores open doors

Parameters:

Returns:

                      Treasure treasure)
Make the mob pick up a treasure item
Note: This method does not check for proximity

Parameters:

treasure - The item to pick up
Returns:

move

public boolean move(double angle,
                    Game game)
Make the mob take a step in the given direction

Parameters:
angle - The angle specifying the direction (in radians)
game - The current game state
Returns:
Returns true if the mob moved; false otherwise

moveToGoal

public boolean moveToGoal(Game game)
Move towards the goal. If goal is reached, set it to null. If no goal, do nothing

Parameters:
game -
Returns:
Returns true if the mob moved; false otherwise

defaultDraw

public void defaultDraw(Graphics2D g,
                        Rectangle2D rect,
                        Color c,
                        boolean highlighted)
Draws the mob as a simple filled circle
  • If the mob is not at full health, a health bar will be drawn below it
  • If the mob is not at full energy, an energy bar will be drawn above it

Parameters:
g - The graphics object
rect - The rectangle the mob should fill
c - The colour to draw the mob with
highlighted - Whether the mob should be highlighted or not
